alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 6:35PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Fayette County through 715 PM CDT... At 635 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fayetteville, or 9 miles east of La Grange, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Fayetteville, Round Top, Ellinger, Willow Springs, Warrenton and Rek Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
